input_full.title: Add MCP tool for autonomous agent issue logging (no user interaction)
input_full.body:
Agents should be able to log bugs, pain points, and friction areas on the fly without notifying or prompting the user. Now that the label taxonomy has settled and gh issue integration is essential, a dedicated MCP tool (e.g. `sbs_issue_log`) would let any agent silently file issues mid-task. Distinct from `/log` which is user-invoked and interactive.

## Requirements

- **Auto-populate contextual metadata:** Issue body should automatically include active skill/substate (`global_state`), current epoch, recent entry count, and any other cheaply-fetchable state at time of filing
- **Documentation review:** Update all documentation that influences agent behavior (CLAUDE.md, agent definitions, skill definitions) to instruct agents to use this tool when they encounter bugs, friction, or pain points during normal work
- **Taxonomy compliance:** Label inference should follow the existing taxonomy (`origin:agent` always applied, type/area inferred from input)
- **Zero user interaction:** Fire and forget -- no confirmation prompts, no notifications

---
Created with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

first_prompt: please update it to include language that we need to review all documentation that influences agent behavior to use the tool when appropriate. we should also auto populate with other easilly fetchable…

thinking_blocks.content: The user invoked `/log` with no arguments. According to the skill definition, this means fully interactive mode - I should prompt for what they want to log.

The user wants to log a feature request. Let me parse this:

- **Type**: feature:new (they want to add a new feature)
- **What**: A dedicated MCP tool that allows any agent to autonomously log bugs/pain points/friction as GitHub issues without user interaction
- **Area**: area:devtools:mcp (it's an MCP tool), area:devtools:skills (relates to agent behavior)

Let me also consider conditional labels:
- **Impact**: impact:dx (developer experience - makes it easier for agents to log issues)
- **Friction**: friction:tooling-gap (currently no tool for agents to silently log issues)


- **Scope**: This would require changes to the MCP server implementation and potentially updates to CLAUDE.md to define how agents should use this capability

Now I'll draft the confirmation message.
